conclusion: Determine how shadows A, B, C, and D will change if the light source moves downward.
Position of shadows is determined by relative positions of light source and object.
If light source moves downward, shadows will move upward.
Size of shadows is influenced by distance between light source and object.
As light source moves closer to ground, shadows become larger.
Shadow A is cast by the ice cream sundae.
Moving light source downward causes Shadow A to move upward and become larger.
Shadow B is cast by the typewriter.
Moving light source downward causes Shadow B to move upward and become larger.
Shadow C is cast by the melon.
Moving light source downward causes Shadow C to move upward and become larger.
Shadow D is cast by the object with the cone.
Moving light source downward causes Shadow D to move upward and become larger.
Final answer: If light source moves downward, all shadows (A, B, C, and D) will move upward and become larger.
